qas.question: About how many hotels does St. Barts have?
How many rooms does the largest hotel in St. Barts have?
How many rooms does the most expensive hotel on the island have?
About how many villas are available for rent in St. Barts?
Which country besides Brazil does St. Barts import its labor force from?
How many of St. Barthelemy's hotels have fewer than 15 rooms?
How many rooms does the smallest hotel on the island have?
What rating does Eden Rock have?
What rating does Cheval Blanc have?
What's the least expensive hotel on the island?

context: St. Barthélemy has about <a0_0><b5_0>25<b5_0/><a0_0/> hotels, most of them with 15 rooms or fewer. The largest has <a1_0>58<a1_0/> rooms. Hotels are classified in the traditional French manner; <b7_0>3 Star<b7_0/>, <b8_0>4 Star<b8_0/> and <b6_0>4<b6_0/> Star Luxe. Of particular note are <b9_0>Eden Rock<b9_0/> and Cheval Blanc. Hotel Le Toiny, the most expensive hotel on the island, has <a2_0>12<a2_0/> rooms. Most places of accommodation are in the form of private villas, of which there are some <a3_0>400<a3_0/> available to rent on the island. The island's tourism industry, though expensive, attracts 70,000 visitors every year to its luxury hotels and villas and another 130,000 people arrive by luxury boats. It also attracts a labour force from Brazil and <a4_0>Portugal<a4_0/> to meet the industry needs.
